alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 5:20AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER LEVELS FALLING... Water levels along the Mendenhall Lake and River in Juneau crested at around 8pm Thursday at 8.64 feet. Little to no additional rainfall into the basin will allow the water levels to steadily fall through the day. When the lake level is near 8 feet, Nugget Falls trail sees some flooding. Along the Mendenhall River, previous elevated water levels and faster flows likely resulted in bank erosion and dangerous tree-fall. Anyone recreating on or near the river should continue to use caution. For Mendenhall Lake : At 4:15am the stage was 8.02 feet and falling. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
